Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an olpe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of lower part of three male figures to left; from left, legs of two naked males; tips of fingers of one figure between them; at right, third figure wearing chiton in added white (folds shown by incised vertical wavy lines) with decorated black border (incised wavy line between incised lines) and himation in added red (black decorated borders and overhanging black folds with decorated borders), holding a spear; at right, two lines of side border; below figures, narrow black band above lower body glazed black.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.48)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 264, no. 40)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 308, no. B316)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 233, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0304) (Phase 1)
